title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: Enrollment statistics for Uttar Pradesh in 2024, categorized by age groups (6-16) and gender. The table details the percentage of children in Government, Private, and Other schools, as well as those not currently enrolled. It also includes longitudinal trends (2006-2024) for out-of-school children aged 11-16 and enrollment shifts in government schools from 2018 to 2024.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Detailed 2022 enrollment data for children aged 3 to 8 in Uttar Pradesh. The table shows the distribution of children across Anganwadis, government pre-primary centers, private LKG/UKG, and formal government/private schools, highlighting early childhood education participation.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Enrollment data for 2024 covering children aged 3 to 8 in Uttar Pradesh. This table tracks participation in pre-schooling (Anganwadi, Govt pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG) versus formal schooling, allowing comparisons with 2022 data regarding school readiness and intake.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: Foundational literacy assessment for Uttar Pradesh students in 2024. The table displays the percentage of children in grades I through VIII categorized by their highest reading proficiency level, ranging from 'not even letter' to 'Standard II level text'.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: Foundational numeracy assessment for Uttar Pradesh in 2024. The table displays the percentage of children in grades I through VIII categorized by their highest arithmetic capability, such as recognizing numbers, performing subtraction, or solving division problems.

data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 10: Smartphone availability and use. By age. 2024
description: Digital access survey results for 2024 covering children aged 14 to 16 in Uttar Pradesh. This table tracks smartphone availability at home, the children's ability to use them for digital tasks, and the percentage of children who personally own a smartphone.
data: | Age | % Children who: | % Children who: | % Children who: | Of those who can use a smartphone, % who have their own smartphone |
| Age | Have a smart-phone at home | Could bring a smartphone to do digital tasks* | Can use a smartphone | Of those who can use a smartphone, % who have their own smartphone |

title: Table 11: Smartphone availability and use among 14-16-year-olds. By sex. 2024
description: Gender-based analysis of smartphone accessibility and ownership for adolescents (ages 14-16) in Uttar Pradesh for 2024. The data compares boys and girls regarding home availability, digital task capability, and personal device ownership.

title: Table 12: Of those who know how to use a smartphone, % children who used a smartphone in the reference week for any educational activity and social media activity, and know how to use safety features. By age. 2024
description: Usage patterns and digital safety awareness among smartphone-using children (ages 14-16) in Uttar Pradesh (2024). The table contrasts educational usage against social media engagement and measures knowledge of safety features like blocking, privacy settings, and password management by age.

title: Table 15: Trends over time
description: Logistical data regarding the ASER survey in Uttar Pradesh, listing the total number of Primary and Upper Primary schools visited during the 2010, 2018, 2022, and 2024 data collection cycles.

title: Table 16: Trends over time
description: Trends in average student and teacher attendance rates in Uttar Pradesh Primary and Upper Primary schools. The table compares attendance data points from 2010, 2018, 2022, and 2024.

title: Table 17: Trends over time
description: Data tracking the percentage of Primary and Upper Primary schools in Uttar Pradesh with low enrollment or specific size characteristics across the years 2010, 2018, 2022, and 2024.

title: Table 18: Multigrade classes. 2024
description: Prevalence of multigrade classroom setups in Uttar Pradesh in 2024. The data indicates the percentage of Primary and Upper Primary schools where Standard I and II children were observed sitting with other grades.
data: | % Schools | Std I children  observed sitting with any other Std | Std II children  observed sitting with any other Std |

title: Table 19: Observation of TLM (Teaching Learning Materials) in classrooms. 2024
description: Classroom observation data for 2024 regarding the availability and display of Teaching Learning Materials (TLM) in Uttar Pradesh. Metrics cover Std I and Std II classrooms in both Primary and Upper Primary schools.
data: | % Schools | TLM observed in classroom (apart from textbooks) | TLM observed in classroom (apart from textbooks) | Of those schools with TLM, work done by students displayed in classroom | Of those schools with TLM, work done by students displayed in classroom |
| % Schools | Std I | Std II | Std I | Std II |

title: Table 20: Trends over time
description: Comprehensive overview of school infrastructure and Right to Education (RTE) compliance in Uttar Pradesh (2010-2024). This table tracks the availability and usability of mid-day meals, drinking water, toilets (including separate girls' toilets), libraries, electricity, and computers.

title: Table 21: Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) activities. 2024
description: Implementation status of Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) initiatives in Uttar Pradesh schools (2023-2025). The table covers government directives, teacher training (offline/online), receipt of TLM/funds, and School Readiness Programmes.
data: | % Schools | % Schools | Received a directive from govt to implement FLN activities with Std I-II/III | At least one teacher received training on FLN | At least one teacher received training on FLN | Received Teaching Learning Materials (TLM) for FLN activities** | Received funds for TLM for FLN activities** | School Readiness Programme held for Std l |

| Current academic year (2024-2025) | Upper primary schools* | 95.7 | 96.2 | 89.0 | 88.3 | 65.1 | 94.2 |

title: Table 23: Distribution of uniforms. 2022, 2024
description: Status of school uniform distribution in Uttar Pradesh for 2022 and 2024. The table highlights the shift towards providing funds (Direct Benefit Transfer) rather than physical uniforms for Primary and Upper Primary schools.
